thread.title: Interstate 405 briefly shut down because of man with knife, police say
thread.title_full: Interstate 405 briefly shut down because of man with knife, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Interstate 405 briefly shut down because of man with knife, police say
text:
Officials briefly shut down an interchange between Interstate 5 and Interstate 405 late Thursday as police attempted to contain a man with a knife, said Sgt. Pete Simpson, a Portland police spokesman.
The incident occurred near the Marquam Bridge, Simpson said. Southbound motorists on Interstate 5 were blocked from entering Interstate 405, Simpson said.
The man was on the freeway, and he appeared to be under the influence of drugs or suffering from mental health issues â€“ or both, Simpson said.
Scanner traffic indicated that officials closed the freeway before 11 p.m. and reopened it shortly after 11:30 p.m.
It wasn't immediately clear whether an arrest was made.
-- Luke Hammill
lhammill@oregonian.com
